title: List of allowed HTML tags in Service Management
content:
This page lists the allowed HTML tags in Service Management. 

The following tags are allowed with attributes: style, id and all styles:

  • Document metadata: <style>*
  • Content sectioning: <body>, <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <h5>, <h6>
  • Text content: <blockquote>, <dd>, <div>*, <dl>, <dt>, <ol>, <ul>, <li>, <p>, <pre>
  • Inline text semantics: <a>*, <b>, <br>, <cite>, <code>, <em>, <i>, <q>, <small>, <span>*, <strong>, <sub>, <sup>, <u>
  • Table content: <caption>, <col>, <colgroup>, <table>*, <tbody>, <td>*, <tfoot>, <th>*, <thead>, <tr>
  • Image: <img>*
  • Deprecated: <strike>, <nobr>
  • Defined by Service Management: <highlight>*, <bookmark>*   Note: Please don't use these two tags when you define HTML formats.

*  In addition, there are specific rules for the tags marked with * : 

  • Tag <highlight> is only allowed with classes: highlight, detected-ci, icon-involved-CIs, new-detected-ci and all attributes.
  • Tag <a> is only allowed with attributes: name, href, target, title, hreflang, media, rel, type, conclick and href is required. If the <a> tag doesn't include href, the whole <a> tag will be removed by the system.
  • Tag <img> is only allowed with attributes: src, alt, width, height and src is required. If the <img> tag doesn't include src, the whole <img> will be removed by the system.
  • Tag <div> is only allowed with attribute: saw-collapsible.
  • Tag <span> is only allowed with classes: SimpleUploadsTmpWrapper, icon-priority-critical, icon-priority-high, icon-priority-low, icon-priority-medium, drop-down-editor-icon, icon-collision.
  • Tag <bookmark> is only allowed with class: cursor-invisible.
  • Tag <style> is only allowed with attributes: accesskey, class, contenteditable, contextmenu, dir, hidden, lang, tabindex, title, translate, type, media, scoped, title, disabled.
  • Tag <table> is only allowed with attributes: height, cellspan, width, cellpadding, border, cellspacing.
    Note: These are deprecated attributes defined in HTML 4.1. We keep these attributes for backward compatibility. It’s recommended to use the attribute style to define CSS for tables.
  • Tag <td> is only allowed with attributes: colspan, align, width, valign, bgcolor.
  • Tag <th> is only allowed with attributes: colspan, scope.
 File protocol (file://) is not supported in Service Portal.
